lines.text: Hey, laser lips, your mama was a snow blower.
Malfunction. Need input.
Number 5 is alive.
[Stephanie is in the bath]

[confused]
Stephanie... change color!

[looks down, embarrassed, reaches for a towel]
Uh...
Attractive! Nice software.
You sure don't talk like a machine...
I am thinking she is a virgin. Or at least she used to be.
Where are you from, anyway?
Bakersfield, originally.
No, I mean your ancestors.
Oh, them. Pittsburgh.
Life is NOT a malfunction.
I am standing here beside myself.
I am sporting a tremendous woody.
Crosby, we're going to have to ask you to surrender the robot.
Stat?
Stat!
What does that mean, anyway?
I don't know. But that's not the point.
Holy shit.
No shit. Where see shit?

[Reading a Billboard]
Wouldn't you like to be a Pepper too?
But you can't die. You're a machine.
No.
No, you're not a machine?
Yes.
Yes, you are, or yes, you're not?
Yes.
Yes, WHAT?
Yes, not.
Talk about a malfunction.

OK. Listen closely. There's a priest, a minister, and a rabbi. They're out playing golf. They're deciding how much to give to charity. The priest says "We'll draw a circle on the ground, throw the money in the air, and whatever lands inside the circle, we'll give to charity." The minister says "No, we'll draw a circle on the ground, throw the money in the air, and whatever lands outside of the circle, that's what we'll give to charity." The rabbi says "No no no. We'll throw the money way up in the air, and whatever God wants, he keeps!"
Hmmmm. Oh, I get it! Ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho ho! Hee hee hee hee hee hee hee hee hee! Nyuk, nyuk nyuk nyuk nyuk nyuk nyuk nyuk nyuk!
What's going on? Is he laughing?
Yeah! Yeah! And the joke wasn't even that funny, and I think I screwed up the punchline. Ha ha ha ha!
"Whatever God wants, he keeps!"
Why did you disobey your program?
Program say to kill, to disassemble, to make dead. Number 5 cannot.
Why "cannot"?
Is *wrong*! Newton Crosby, Ph.D not know this?
Of course I know it's wrong to kill, but who told you?
*I* told me.
Newton, we are wasting valueless time here.
I don't know about you, but I am planning to scream and run.
Will he kill me if I stop?
Who is to say?
Will he kill me if I don't stop?
Again I am shrugging.
I'm stopping.
Good choice.
...and I'm going to need some Hueys.
Some what?
HELICOPTERS, Howard. Jesus Christ!
I thought they were choppers.
Well, now they're called Hueys.
Well, why wasn't I notified?
What if it goes out and melts down a bus load of nuns? How would you like to write the headline on that one?
Nun soup?
Hey! Who told you you could take Number One?
Howard, logically, if we need protection from Number Five - this is the best weapon we could have.
Great. Great. So, instead of 11 million dollars on the loose - we're gonna have twenty-two.
And plus, we are needing gas money.
What planet is this guy from?
Colt .45. Semi-automatic.
[crushes the gun]
Play-doh.
I have seen some strange, bizarre drivers, but you. You will be awarded a cake.
Don't tell me its laser is still armed.
Bimbo.
Bye-bye, goofy woman. I enjoyed repeatedly throwing you to the ground.
[when driving a campervan into a fish hung on a wire]
Fish. Salmon. Sushi.
Yes, I'd like to speak to one of your head warmongers, please.
Beautiful animal... canine... dog... mutt.
I hope you took the grass out of the glove compartment.
Can you believe it's been five years since I've driven?
I would say ten.

[they're heading for the cliff]
Oh, no - Jeez! Number Five, we're gonna be killed!
Disassemble?
Yes, disassemble ALL OVER THE PLACE!
I thought you were alive, Number 5. I let you tear my house to shreds and you're a ROBOT! You're a machine from that dumb war lab place. God, I'm so stupid!
Stupid - foolish, gullible, doltish, dumbell...
How, robot. Me - friend.
Talk computer, not Apache.
Number 5 stupid name... want to be Kevin or Dave!
Bird. Raven. Nevermore.
Frankie, you broke the unwritten law. You ratted on your friends. When you do that Frankie, your enemies don't respect you. You got no friends no more. You got nobody, Frankie.
Where is he? I need him! Stat!
Excuse me, sir? Crosby? He is hiding in the toilet, sir.
Public relations is everybody's job.
He's saying that the crowds, they are making him dog sick, sir...
Look, he's supposed to be here, I want him here, I *pay* him to be here.
Well, the last time I'm seeing him, he is busy womiting, sir.
Well, clean him up and send him out, to hobnob. Stat!
"Unable. Malfunction."
How can it refuse to turn itself off?
Maybe it's pissed off.
It's a machine, Schroeder. It doesn't get pissed off. It doesn't get happy, it doesn't get sad, it doesn't laugh at your jokes.

[in unison]
It just runs programs.
It usually runs programs.

[taking N5 for an extraterrestrial being]
Oh, my God! I knew they'd pick me. I just knew it!... Hello? Well, I guess... Welcome to my planet!

[to N5 who'd been watching TV all night]
... You know you lose IQ points the longer you watch. There've been actual studies!
Boy am I the jerk of the world!
Turkey, idiot, pain in the ass.

[as John Wayne]
Ah don't worry little lady, I'll fix their wagon.
So now I am having no job to speak about. I will have to smack the sidewalk.

[imitating Elmer Fudd after having seen the show on Stephanie's TV]
Well, I guess that waps you up, you wascally wobot - huhgh-huhgh-huhgh-huhgh-huhgh-huhgh-huhgh-huhgh-huhgh!
Benjamin Jabituya, delete.
No, wait! Rethink yourself!
Exit. Depart. Leave.
Eat my dust, Newton Crosby. Let us break wind.
[leaves]
Newton Crosby, no run, no talk, drive.
[Crosby stalls]
Today, Crosby! Today!
Looks like you have created another Frankfurter's monster.
Not malfunction Stephanie. Number 5 is alive.
Number 5, What do you make of this?
[hands Number 5 a Rorschach blot he just made using tomato soup]
Hmmm... Wood pulp, plant - vegetable - tomato, water, salt, monosodium glutamate...
Okay, thank you. Now you're talking like a robot.
...and resemble - look like - butterfly, bird, maple leaf!

[to Number 5]
Listen, why don't you say we jump in my car and I'll take you home.

[knowingly]
Uh, tell him where home is.
Uh, home is NOVA.
[Beasley barks]

[throws tray at Frank]
NOVA? NO! No disassemble!
Run, Number 5, run!
Come on, treads, don't fail me now!

[runs after him]
You tricked me, you little bitch!
Oh, does this mean I don't get my $5,000? Well, forget it! FORGET IT! He can run thirty miles an hour, you big stupid JERK!

[grabs her]
Hey, I'll show you how stupid I am! Guess who's gonna help me catch him!
No, I'd rather die first!

[sees that his Pontiac is gone]
What the hell happened to my car?
Hi!
[Frank's car is shown totally dismantled]
Piece of cake!
Oh, my God! My car!

[smiles]
Oh, way to go, Number 5!
Kick ass? Donkey, mule, burrow.
With excitement like this, who is needing enemas?
Ooh. Her pants are blazing for you, Newton Crosby.
Will you grow up?
Crosby, what's it gonna do?
Howard it's hard to say, it's malfunctioning, it may not do anything.
But it COULD decide to blow away anything that moves, couldn't it? COULDN'T IT CROSBY?
Who is knowing how to read the mind of a robot?
Did she stick her tongue down your throat?
What the hell does it need input for?
I don't know; I guess it can't triangulate its position.
That's a simple function.
Can you triangulate YOUR position, Howard?
No.
Well, then - there you go!
[about the robots]
Originally I had non-military purposes in mind. I designed it as a marinal aid.
Many fragments. Some large, some small.
This may be hilarious where you come from, but on this planet it's considered rude.
Are you sure you weren't doing any steering or anything like that?
Yeah, I like to drive off cliffs.
No disassemble Number Five!
Well, if you gotta go, don't squeeze the Charmin.
[makes a computer hand show its middle finger to Ben and chuckles very smugly]
Is that a 'yes' or the number of your intelligence quotient, uh?

The only way to secure the peace, Senator, as I'm sure you know, is to be prepared. See, we can parachute these robot guys behind enemy lines. They hide out till the first strike blows over. Then each one is able to just carry a 25-megaton bomb right up the middle of Main Street Moscow - like the mailman bringing bad news. We call it Operation 'Gotcha LAST!'
That's what you call 'ENSURING PEACE'?
'Ensuring peace'.
No, I'm sure we'll all agree that Dr Crosby has designed a weapon which will keep our world safe for all time.
Howard, what's so safe about blowing people up?

[explaining why he'd just been trying to capture Steph's dog]
... you know he looked kinda sick to me, so I thought I'd just take 'im down to the vet and fix 'im up a little bit.
He doesn't look sick. YOU look sick.
Newton, you know what is out there in the great outdoors? Girls. Mmmmm! With brassieres and legs - mmm. You have a working knowledge of girls?
No, but I read about 'em.
Oh, then... maybe I can furnish you with some schematic drawings?

[to a possible client, over the phone]
Oh... I'm sorry, I - but I just... I have to draw the line at SNAKES. Yeah, I'm sure it would make a wonderful pet - but... Wait, isn't there a home for cobras somewhere?

[to N5 reciting TV commercials]
OK, you didn't come a million miles to do television commercials, did you?

[on seeing the Sun]
Oooooo! Beautiful. Light bulb.
No - sun.
Beautiful No-sun.

[ending her phone conversation with NOVA's Marner]
... never mind, go back to your nuclear warheads.
Error. Grasshopper disassembled... Re-assemble!
Oh, bull dyke! You cannot hold your water with that story, girl.

[about the SAINT robots]
So - what are these guys used for, anyway?
It's top-secret crap.
That's what I figured.
...Where're you taking him?
This is not being a HIM. It's only being wires and several mechanisms and other such machine-type apparatus, for the Pete of sake - the sate of Peeckle...
Okay, to make these golden fluffy pancakes... add flour, milk and eggs... Mix thoroughly...
[uses his own motor to rotate the mixer - the bowl contents splatter all over the room]
Ooooo... Still lumpy!

[parodying a TV presenter's voice during his fight against the other SAINTs]
"Escaped Robot Fights for His Life. Film at Eleven."
[after Number 5 is seemingly destroyed]

[cheerfully]
Now that, my friend, is how you kick ass!
Years of research are down the tubes, and you're happy as a pig in slops.

[proudly]
Just doing my job, sir.
Maybe from now on you can do it somewhere else.
Number 5
[Pushing Skroeder away]
No, no, please. No autographs, sir!
[Grabs Stephanie]
Come Stephanie! We be jamming!
[Busts out side of wall of Black Lion]

[noticing that Newton is having a hard time driving through the semi-dark streets of town]
Do you know what most people are liking at night?
No, what?
Headlights.
[reaches across the dashboard and switches the lights on]
Oh, yeah... that's a lot better! Thanks!
Dr. Warmonger - I mean, Dr. Marner!

[after watching Crosby disassemble Number 5]
What the hell is the matter with you, you four-eyed idiot?

[mumbling to himself]
What an asshole.

[angrily]
I heard that!

[just before he and Crosby go to meet with the public]
Please wait for me. I need to go and use the jack.
It's the "john."

[On CB]
Crosby, it's Howard. If you don't have my van back in 15 minutes...!
[Number 5 blows up CB]
Let me tell you something. I don't like those NOVA guys any more than you do. In fact, I don't care if they ever get Number 5 back. But I wanna see it.
You will not experiment on him, you will not flip the switches, and you will not take him apart?
Absolutely. You have my word.
Okay. He's out back. I'll take you to him.

[walks up to them]
Well, while you're at it, young lady, you can take me, too.

[surprised]
Skroeder!
Terrific job, Crosby. Thanks for the help.
No. I had nothing to do with this!
You bastard! You're a liar!

[spilling and dumping the contents out of the glasses and boxes on Stephanie's counter]
Drinking glass... Pasta, spaghetti!

[picking up one of her kittens away from Number 5's mess]
Very good...

[dumping out spaghetti sauce out of a sauce pan]
Liquid, spaghetti sauce...
Look! This may be funny from where you come from! But on this planet, it's considered rude!

[distracted by baskets of fruit]
Oooo... Baskets... fruit!
[proceeds to dump the fruit out of the metal baskets by pushing the baskets upward]

[as he dumps the fruit]
Oranges, Apples, Lemons, Limes...

[sarcastically]
Why great! Thanks a lot!

[to Newton; screaming hysterically, banging his fists on the table]
I AM NOT HAVING THIS ANYMORE, CROSBY! IT WAS YOUR FAULT THAT YOU HAD TO TALK TO THESE PEOPLE!
